p: EOs repellence [ 17, 18], larvicidal [ 19, 20, 21], and insecticidal activities are proven on different arthropod pests of economic importance [ 22, 23, 24, 25]. Among them, the EOs’ efficacy has also been investigated on some Lepidoptera. Good examples are represented by Cydia pomonella (Linneaus) (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae) [ 26], Thaumetopoea pityocampa (Denis & Schiffermüller) (Lepidoptera: Notodontidae) [ 27], Cadra cautella (Walker) (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae) [ 28] as well as Spodoptera littoralis (Boisd.) [ 29, 30, 31] and Spodoptera litura (Fabr.) (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) [ 32, 33, 34]. However, current knowledge about EOs toxicity on L. botrana larvae is strictly limited [ 35].
